definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze

sentences.english: The carcass of a burned-out building.
sentences.chinese: 燒燬建築物的基本構架。

sentences.english: Li Zhongming would burn up those drawings, he left home leave Yang Nian letters.
sentences.chinese: 黎仲明將那些圖紙燒燬，他臨走時給楊念留下書信。

sentences.english: Militants burn NATO fuel tankers in Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦民兵燒燬北約運油車。

sentences.english: Many have been struck by lightning and burned to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 許多建築被閃電擊中燒燬於地，另一些被軍閥燒燬。

sentences.english: Many have been struck by lightning and burned to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 許多建築被閃電擊中燒燬於地，另一些被軍閥燒燬。

sentences.english: The huge factory was gutted in minutes.
sentences.chinese: 那座大工廠的內部於幾分鐘內全部燒燬。

sentences.english: They threatened to burn down our house.
sentences.chinese: 他們威脅要燒燬我們的房子。

sentences.english: The motor of frequently reversible discharging equipment is very easy to be burnt out.
sentences.chinese: 頻繁可逆運轉卸料設備，其電動機極易燒燬。

sentences.english: That would incinerate the heart of a major city.
sentences.chinese: 它能夠燒燬一座大型城市的中心地帶。

sentences.english: This machine is designed to burn up if overused.
sentences.chinese: 那個機器，按其設念，如果過度使用就會燒燬。

sentences.english: What induced these people to burn houses and to murder their fellow-creatures?
sentences.chinese: 是什麼迫使這些人燒燬房屋和殺害自己的同類呢？

sentences.english: I should return to Verus and show him the charred transcript.
sentences.chinese: 我應該返回維洛司處，將燒燬的抄本交給他。

sentences.english: The Churchill bushfire burnt out more than 30, 000 hectares of land.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉爾山火燒燬了超過3萬公頃的土地。

sentences.english: It was built using oak and the exterior is clad in burnt larch wood.
sentences.chinese: 這是採用橡木和外部是穿着燒燬落葉松木材。

sentences.english: The fire has destoryed hundreds of homes and forced thousands of people to evacuate.
sentences.chinese: 大火燒燬了數百座住房，數千人被迫轉移。

sentences.english: The spacecraft burned up when it re-entered the earth's atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙飛船重新進入地球大氣層時燒燬了。

definition: to burn down/to destroy with fire/trad. also written 焚毀
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
Kai Tak Airport, international airport of Hong Kong from 1925 to 1998
